IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION HELPS YOUTH AND FAMILIES GROW EMOTIONALLY, BEHAVIORALLY, AND EDUCATIONALLY THROUGH A VARIETY OF SERVICES INCLUDING RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT CENTERS, CAMPUS SCHOOL, HEALTH HOMES, FOSTER CARE, DETENTION SERVICES, MANAGED CARE, PARENTING FOR TEENS, COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES, GROUP HOMES, AND DIAGNOSTIC SERVICES. EACH SERVICE UTILIZES THE ORGANIZATION'S EFFECTIVE TREATMENT PHILOSOPHY. THE ORGANIZATION NURTURES, CHALLENGES, AND EMPOWERS THE CHILD AND THE WHOLE FAMILY. THE ORGANIZATION HELPS TO BUILD THE SKILLS TO LIVE PRODUCTIVE AND FULFILLING LIVES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVIDE CARE FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, INCLUDING EDUCATIONAL, COUNSELING AND THERAPEUTIC SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT - SERVICES INCLUDING COUNSELING, CLINICAL CASE MANAGEMENT, THERAPEUTIC RECREATION, LIFE SKILLS, ANIMAL ASSISTED THERAPY, MEDICAL AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, EDUCATION AND OUTDOOR ADVENTURE PROGRAM. WYNDHAM LAWN HOME AND RANDOLPH CHILDRENS HOME.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HENRIETTA G. LEWIS CAMPUS SCHOOL PROVIDES EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER SERVICES TO CHILDREN FOR STUDENTS KINDERGARTEN THROUGH GRADE 12. STUDENTS SERVED INCLUDE CHILDREN ENROLLED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S LOCKPOT, NY RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS STUDENTS FROM OTHER SCHOOL DISTRICTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HEALTH HOMES - THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES THREE HEALTH HOMES SERVING ERIE COUNTY, NIAGARA COUNTY, AND THE SOUTHERN TIER OF NEW YORK STATE USING A MODEL OF CARE MANAGEMENT BASED UPON THE BELIEF THAT EVERY FAMILY HAS STRENGHTS AND THAT FAMILIES ARE THE NATURAL AND MOST EFFECTIVE DRIVERS OF THEIR CARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ERIE COUNTY NON-SECURE DETENTION - PROVIDES SERVICES TO YOUTH AWAITING ACTION BY FAMILY COURT. CHILDREN ARE HOUSED IN A FACILITY LOCATED AT GATEWAY-LONGVIEW, WILLIAMSVILLE, NEW YORK.

GLOBAL VILLAGE THERAPEUTIC FOSTER CARE - THERAPEUTIC FOSTER CARE IS PROVIDED TO CHILDREN FROM BIRTH TO AGE 18 IN FOSTER HOMES LOCATED IN ALL EIGHT COUNTIES OF WESTERN NEW YORK. SERVICES INCLUDE COUNSELING,CLINICAL CASE MANAGEMENT,PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, AND YOUTH MENTORING.
MEDICAL - HEALTH CARE SERVICES PROVIDED TO CHILDREN.
PARTNERS IN PARENTING - PROVIDES SOCIAL WORK SERVICES WITH PARENTS TO TEACH THEM PARENTING STRATEGIES, SET LIMITS, AND APPROPRIATELY DISCIPLINE CHILDREN.
DIAGNOSTICS - PROVIDES SERVICES FOR CHILDREN THAT HARD TO PLACE. RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT FOR CLIENTS WITH MULTIPLE DIAGNOSES THAT HAVE BEEN REJECTED BY LOWER LEVELS OF CARE.
MANAGED CARE - PROVIDES WRAP-AROUND SERVICES INCLUDING COUNSELING, IN HOME TREATMENT, AND PREVENTIVE SERVICES TO FAMILIES AND CHILDREN IN ERIE COUNTY, NEW YORK.

ZAFRON HOUSE - PROVIDES CARE FOR UP TO SEVEN TEEN AGE MOTHERS AND THEIR INFANTS AT A FACILITY LOCATED IN SALAMANCA, NEW YORK. SERVICES INCLUDE COUNSELING, CHILD CARE, EDUCATIONAL ADVOCACY, MEDICAL AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, LIFE AND PARENTING SKILLS.
UNIVERAL PRE KINDERGARTEN - EDUCATION PROGRAM FOR 3-4 YEAR OLD CHILDREN THAT HAVE DEVELOPMENTAL ISSUES.
SOUTHERN TIER COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS - SERVICES INCLUDE PARTNERS IN PARENTING, WHICH IS A PREVENTITIVE PROGRAM.
ERIE COUNTY PREVENTIVE - COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES WHEREBY THE SOCIAL WORKERS GO INTO THE HOMES TO WORK WITH FAMILIES TO AVOID PLACEMENT OF THE CHILD.

CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY GROUP HOME - PROVIDES A COMMUNITY BASED SETTING FOR SIX TEENAGE MALES AND FEMALES LOCATED IN CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY, NEW YORK. SERVICES AT THIS BOARDING HOME INCLUDE COUNSELING, EDUCATIONAL ADVOCACY, MEDICAL AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, LIFE SKILLS AND OPPORTUNITY FOR COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.

WESTON MILLS GROUP HOME - PROVIDES A COMMUNITY BASED SETTING FOR SIX TEENAGE MALES LOCATED IN WESTON MILLS, NEW YORK. SERVICES AT THIS BOARDING HOME INCLUDE COUNSELING, EDUCATIONAL ADVOCACY, MEDICAL AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES, LIFE SKILLS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.

DIRECT CARE WORKERS - HOURLY SERVICES THAT ARE CONTRACTED BY SEVERAL AGENCIES. A VARIETY OF SERVICES ARE PROVIDED INCLUDING SOCIAL WORK, MENTORING, YOUTH WORK, AND PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES. THESE SERVICES ARE DELIVERED IN THE HOME.
NIAGARA COUNTY OMH - A VARIETY OF SERVICES ARE PROVIDED INCLUDING FAMILY SUPPORT, CRISIS SERVICES, AND SERVICE MANAGEMENT. THESE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED IN THE HOME OF CLIENTS.

ERIE COUNTY INTENSIVE PREVENTIVE - COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES WHEREBY THE SOCIAL WORKERS GO INTO THE HOMES TO WORK WITH FAMILIES TO AVOID PLACEMENT OF THE CHILD. THESE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED 5 OUT OF THE 7 DAYS A WEEK.

SUPERVISED INDEPENDENT LIVING (SILP) - THE PROGRAM IS FOR CLIENTS THAT HAVE AGED OUT OF THE SYSTEM AND ARE PLACED IN AN APARTMENT. THESE CLIENTS ARE PROVIDED WITH SUPPOT, RESOURCES TO LINK THEM TO COMMUNITY SERVICES, JOB SEARCHES, AND ARE EDUCATED TO LIVE ON THEIR OWN. CLIENTS ENERALLY HAVE NO FAMILY RESOURCES.

ACHIEVE - A GRANT AND COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAM THAT SERVES YOUTH AGES 12-21 THAT WORK WITH A TRIAD TEAM (CARE MANAGER, PARENT ADVOCATE AND YOUTH ADVOCATE). THE PROGRAM FOLLOWS THE WRAP AROUND PHILOSOPHY TO HELP INCREASE POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN HOME, SCHOOL, COMMUNITY, AND DECREASE OUT OF HOME PLACEMENTS AND HOSPITALIZATIONS.

ARTICLE 31 CLINIC - AN OFFICE OF MENTAL HEALTH LICENSED OUTPATIENT CLINIC LOCATED IN NIAGARA FALLS, NEW YORK. THE CLINICAL WORKERS PROVIDE A VARIETY OF MENTAL HEALTH AND COUNSELING SERVICES TO CHILDREN.

ERIE COUNTY FAMILY GROUP MEETINGS - THE COUNTY REFERS FAMILIES TO THE PROGRAM TO KEEP CHILDREN OUT OF PLACEMENT IN RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT AND IN THEIR HOMES. IN ADDITION, THE PROGRAM SCHEDULES ACTIVITES FOR AFTER SCHOOL, COMMUNITY HELP, AND FAMILY ASSISTANCE.
RECREATION BUILDING - THE STUDENTS OF RANDOLPH ACADEMY UTILIZE THE POOL FACILITY LOCATED IN RANDOLPH, NEW YORK.

ERIE COUNTY WRAP - FUNDS ARE RECEIVED FROM THE MANAGED CARE CONTRACT TO HELP CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WITH EXPENSES THAT THE FAMILIES CANNOT AFFORD TO PAY. THESE INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO UTILITIES, FOOD, AND FURNITURE
NEW DIRECTIONS FOUNDATION INC.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN NEW DIRECTIONS FOUNDATION INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990, RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX, FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, 2017, AND 2016 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: PASS THROUGH OF ESTATE CONTRIBUTION RECEIVED DURING YEAR.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS OF NEW YORK INC (CCNY)

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: ORGANIZATION'S BOARD MEMBER AND KEY EMPLOYEE ARE BOARD MEMBERS OF CCNY.
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: WRAP DOLLARS PAID FOR DIRECT CARE WORKERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING. THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED WITH THE CPA THAT PREPARED THE FORM 990, AND IS THEN FORMALLY APPROVED FOR FILING BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ASSIGNED THE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT TO THE CFO TO REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITOR COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO IS REVIEWED PERIODICALLY BY THE BOARD CHAIR AND SECRETARY. THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE IS REVIEWED WITH RESPECT TO GOVERNANCE POLICIES AND PROGRESS IN MEETING THE GOALS SET DURING HIS REVIEW THE PRIOR YEAR. SALARIES WERE ALSO DETERMINED VIA A COMPARISON OF ENTITY SIZE, GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION AND INDUSTRY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED EITHER ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE TAX YEAR.

IdRelatedOrgTxblPartnershipGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: PLAN AND OPERATE AS A HEALTH HOME FOR CHILDREN
